Information From the Restaurant Offers
Description: The Cheesecake Factory is a American (New) , Grill , and Pub Food restaurant where most Menuism users came for a family meal , paid between $25 and $50 , and tipped more than 18% . Tags: American (New), Grill, Pub Food, Salads, Sandwiches, Good For Kids, Takeout, Good for groups, Burgers, and Pizza Stats: 957 dishes entered by diners at The Cheesecake Factory
Nothing yet.

Reviews for The Cheesecake Factory Write a review 4 reviews First reviewed by justmyopinion
"Hot Cars and Great Food."
0 helpful votes over 8 reviews justmyopinion 8 Restaurant Reviews 0
Add as friend Send Msg The Cheesecake Factory justmyopinion January 15, 2012 2.0 2.0 star rating 0 0 0 0 Votes Seared (AHI style) Tuna Salad Entree... disappointed
Large and varied menu selection.
entree seemed like an appetizer portion at best.
Dishes I tried:
Seared Tuna Tataki Salad
2.0 star rating
Slight fishy odor.
2-3 ounces of seared tuna! five small slices? (2 ounces is probably overgenerous estimation of the portion size)
1 and a half to two ounces of mixed greens (seriously?) yes seriously. it was not even a handfull!
3 (three) slices of tomatoe!
a quarter (1/4) of an avacado (that someone has no clue on how to prep for presentation).
for $16.50…I’ve had appetizers at (that australian bar b) steakhouse of seared Ahi Tuna for around $10.00 that was more filling than this entree.
I mentioned this to the server, after the dinner that the size of the salad was shockingly small, but also told her not to worry about it at this point. It was not the servers fault and I did ask her to tell her management later that I was surprised at the size of the entree.
The wifes chopped salad was huge. I felt taken advantage of.
I tried to eat somewhat healthy and left starved.
The bill was $44.07 and I left an $8 dollar tip.
The value proposition just didn’t seem fair to me, even the day after.
We arrived at 5:30 on a saturday, early enough to avoid the evening crowd, it should have been so much more than it was. Link To Review

March 21, 2006
5 star rating
More than just cheesecake
Depending on where you sit, the atmosphere can be fairly private to noisy. The hues and fixtures create a lush feel, almost to the point of decadence.
We've eaten here at least 10 times, with only one negative incident. Having waited ~40…

November 4, 2005
5 star rating
Gorgeous!
This was my first experience at The Cheesecake Factory after hearing lots about it, not sure what to expect. HUGE menu, excellent food, a little pricey but something for everyone. We were seated immediately. Portion sizes were adequate.…
read full review» diva216 from Citysearch
October 17, 2004
3 star rating
All Hype, Very Expensive
The restaurant policy is no reservations. We waited over TWO HOURS to be seated. There was no where to sit while waiting. Most of us stood the entire time. Simply ridiculous.
We finally got to our table, and the waitress was wonderful.…
